thread.title: The Concept of Rights Went With Responsibilities

author: wsjcom
title: The Concept of Rights Went With Responsibilities
text: In Martin Peretz’s review of James Loeffler’s “Rooted Cosmopolitans” on the evolution of the idea of human rights over the past century, he identifies this as a Jewish-nurtured idea (Bookshelf, May 9). Yet the connection of Jews to their countries, peoplehood and a distinct land predates the era of rights. It is important to note that before the 20th century Jews defined their connections to God, people, others and themselves in terms of duties and responsibilities.
